comments.body: Nice idea +1 Vote :)
Hi

not the elytra part 

And, bosses are supposed to be hostile, not neutral and just giving random gifts.
This would be waaaaaaaaaaaay against minecraft! How easy would iron farms be? Tooooooo easy.... bad

Shouldn't you give Iron golems 15 iron instead of apples to breed since iron golems are made out of iron and it should be able to heal them, and villagers have bread and other crops because it necessary for them not to starve. When both have enough they fall in love mode and if found a mate Wala they breed a baby Villager or iron golems, depends on what you are breeding
398956379872 yes the would make sense but I am proud of my idea

398949766112

That wasnt very nice , I was proud of this idea

And if people really have to abuse my idea then go ahead

But please dont come up to someone on An idea / bug report page and say something as rude as that

No offense, we might be better off with just iron golems. You can just use iron to repair them, and plus breeding makes things a bit overpowered. They are just living statues, not exactly humanoid otherwise.
How would it even work
I think that you should use iron blocks since they are made of iron and it would also make them more expensive to breed, making iron farms with this tactic possible but not overpowered.
Very cool idea but like if it's a cave mob and giraffe-esque it would bang it's head.
This is a pretty cool and unique idea! One thing I would change though is it being apart of the cave update, as mossy giraffes sound like they would be in a jungle biome instead.
I don't think it should be fully passive, the nether is a hostile environment.

I think this is a great Idea, It could have great potentinal especially with different variants. The only thing I dont like is how it gets its food from nether portal remnants , if it does get its food for portal remnats it should be growable. Also I love your drawing, your an amazing artist.
Maybe they can also increase your garden‚Äôs growing speed if they are within 3 blocks of your crop.

I thought of this too. Why not also add this to normal, passive mobs, like sheep and cows? They only see a smaller part of the visible spectrum, so when we spectate them we should only be able to see colors they see, like how dogs only see shades of blue and yellow
Like a new vision for axolotl or for the phantom.

I love this idea for a new mob, but I don't know about the name and the health points. I think 25 health points would be more reasonable since it has a defensive "attack". I also think it should always spawn with gilded blackstone. maybe its name could be a combination of turtle and Basalt? bartle? 

I think this is a great idea and hope it is added into the game.
i like the idea. it would make a nice sort of miniboss. maybe lower the health and damage by a couple points and maybe add a weakness.

I like the idea of a "turtle from the bowels" and I like the idea of diversifying the basalt deltas. BUT how big and clumsy creature will move through steep drops and puddles of lava? They will also ugly levitate at the edges of the blocks.
This mob will look good in the ocean of lava, it's not for nothing that turtles do not live in the mountains.

I like this idea. I agree with everything that you said, but maybe the zombified version of the mobs could be slightly slower (especially the rabbits and wolves). But there should not be any zombified versions of hostile mobs (like enferman, skeletons, creepers, etc. (wolves are an exception)). I love this idea!

Personally, I would prefer to keep the current brown mooshroom mechanics and have nether fungi mooshrooms be obtainable by breeding red or brown mooshrooms in the Nether, maybe having the chance increase if the parents are one of each brown and red rather than two of the same.
New mushrooms New Mooshrooms
Cute, and interesting! üëç
Very creative!
Interesting, creative but I'd like to see it go between land and water, it being the swamp and all.
Interesting, creative but I'd like to see it go between land and water, it being the swamp and all.
Interesting I'll vote for it
It's neat how it's based on an actual creature from Greek mythology.

The biome is called Warped, not Twisted
Their name originates form the words Pisces which is the zodiac sign that has a symbol which is a fish. And Cinder a combustible piece of charcoal.
All your posts are so creative and cool! Keep up the AMAZING work!
Thank you Vinecraft46! It is good to know that I have a fan!
It is annoying to try and get babies

I do agree with the addition of Gharials since they'd be a nice, more Minecraft appropriate alternative to crocodiles, with their passive nature and endangered status. but how would that make rotting flesh more useful? they only eat fish and I doubt they would gain anything special from eating the flesh of a zombie.
To go off of the last persons comment, I'd like to add that since tropical fish have less use than most other types of raw fish they could make for a more fitting alternative to rotten flesh.

This Gharial doesn't actually attack humans, so I think it will probably be neutral.
We usually prey on fish, but rotten meat can be used for breeding.
In addition, it is possible to hold the killed fish in the mouth, and when the fish is hungry, it is eaten.
Seriam √≥timos. S√£o crocodilos especializados em peixes, n√£o atacam humanos a n√£o ser que sejam atacados
So what? Ya falcon punch you dog it starts glowing and now you have a SUPERMAN BUT DOG!
These could be great for dog armor
My feedback for this suggestion would be that in order to enchant the dogs, one would use a book of enchanting on a bone and feed the bone to the dogs.
Maybe they could be equiped by a collar on your dog? Then your enchanting an item and not an entity. Love the idea.
I like this
YES. This would be so cute!! Maybe the wild spawning ones would be Servals, and could be bred with other tamed cats to make Savannah kittens?

I think that's a great idea!

And it would be cool to have a flying house!

The cloud beast would be a good companion on your travels! :)

Mojang have said no as it is nostalgic, and changing the texture would cause controversy.

Though, I would really like it to be changed...
I Think Creepers Look Just Fine.
Creepers haver the second worst texture.
While it is nostalgic, I feel like its so outdated that it needs a change, even if its just a different shade of green. They've already updated some other old mobs.
Por favor pessoal ap√≥iem a ideia.
Sorry but I speak English

Mr.Sadhy

This is my idea of ‚Äã‚Äãa halloween pumpkin head skeleton with a brown sorcerer hat that has the power to magically move blocks from one place to another and throw those blocks at the player, this min will only attack if you break into his house which is inside the mountains, and if the player manages to break in but not kill Me.Sadhy, he will go until the player takes revenge, and for the player to protect his house he will have to put Halloween pumpkins around, This will make it understand that that house is not a target. This creature will have the ability to fly and transform any block into another block with his enchanted wand, and if the player wins the creature, he can only move the blocks with the enchanted wand. And the creature will wear a leather boot. He will be a boss because he looks like a tough mob.

Translated to English .

I think finding other animals is to much instead it would be like a wolf and a fox it will help in fight but it will fox like attacks and if you drop something like a sword it will use it. P.S it should be a coyote

I think this is a good Idea this should be pointed out and viewed and thought about only 5 people have voted this leys make 10000 votes!!! or less if I'm going to far besides the point this could be a good addition to mincraft
i'll get you votes, don't worry
Cool idea but I think that it should also steal the items dropped by mob or player

I had thought about it stealing food items and rotten flesh, though that was because I imagine it in a wolf-like way. I only suggested the main mechanics, but adding on additional ideas like that would make it a cool monster!
If it does end up being a wolf-like creature, slinker might be a good name for it.
I really love this idea! Maybe it should spawn in the overworld too???

It certainly could. This concept was brainstormed during the development of the Nether Update, so that was on my mind a lot when this post was made. It is somewhat dangerous, so if it does get reworked for another dimension it should be in a place where the players will expect it. Maybe in a new cave biome...
